CWEs: CWE-209: Information Exposure Through an Error Message
description: The function is vulnerable to several issues. Firstly, it exposes potentially sensitive information through error messages (CWE-209). When an error occurs, it logs the error and sends the error message to the client. This could potentially leak sensitive server information to the client. Secondly, the function does not limit the size of the body that can be sent in a request (CWE-400). This could potentially lead to a denial of service attack if a large amount of data is sent. Lastly, the function does not validate the input it receives (CWE-20). This could lead to various attacks
